meanings.definition: To rule or govern as a tyrant.
meanings.sent1: The king was tyrannizing his subjects, making unfair laws and punishing anyone who disagreed.
meanings.sent2: The dictator was known for tyrannizing the people, suppressing their freedoms and enforcing strict regulations.
meanings.sent3: The evil queen in the story was always tyrannizing the villagers, demanding unreasonable taxes and harsh punishments.
meanings.sent4: The bully in the schoolyard was like a tyrant, constantly tyrannizing the other kids and making their lives miserable.
meanings.sent5: The tyrannizing boss made the workplace a hostile environment, ruling with an iron fist and showing no mercy to employees.

meanings.definition: To exercise oppressive power or control over others.
meanings.sent1: The oppressive regime was constantly tyrannizing its citizens, monitoring their every move and silencing any dissent.
meanings.sent2: The corrupt officials were accused of tyrannizing the local community, abusing their authority for personal gain.
meanings.sent3: The strict teacher was always tyrannizing the students, giving them excessive homework and strict deadlines.
meanings.sent4: The dark cloud of fear was tyrannizing the small town, making everyone feel trapped and powerless.
meanings.sent5: The tyrannizing landlord raised the rent prices unfairly, forcing many tenants to struggle to make ends meet.

meanings.definition: To act in a cruel or harsh manner towards others.
meanings.sent1: The mean-spirited supervisor was constantly tyrannizing his subordinates, belittling them and making unreasonable demands.
meanings.sent2: The bullies were tyrannizing the new kid at school, making fun of him and excluding him from activities.
meanings.sent3: The strict coach was always tyrannizing the players, pushing them to their limits and showing no mercy.
meanings.sent4: The storm was tyrannizing the small town, destroying homes and leaving the residents devastated.
meanings.sent5: The tyrannizing customer was rude to the waiter, demanding special treatment and insulting the service.
